channel.title: My very first script (autotalker)

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @iron_man_ftw iron man ftw
item.description:
@iron_man_ftw wrote:

Hey good job, the first script is always the hardest man. SCAR's good to know, I've been finding all kinds of crackpot uses for it. Whats your next script gonna be then?

I’ve made a auto-banner recently. Attempting to make a powercutter right now. Then i’m going to try making a power miner. Then find out more random stuff about scar. Maybe make a movie :P.

Read full topic

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @jvwarrior jvwarrior
item.description:
@jvwarrior wrote:

Its a good script overall. You have to get better at it. Eventually your gonna make more better working scripts. I started just as u did. I came out with 6 autotalkers each with better stuff on it and eventually I started making power miners and power choppers. Just start to learn some Srl stuff and itll get easier.

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @iron_man_ftw iron man ftw
item.description:
@iron_man_ftw wrote:

84 views, 5 replies? 2 being mine…?

EDIT: Now 94 views and what like 6 replies… Theres gotta be something i can do to this autotalker to make it less detectable (without making like 1000 lines in a autotalker.)

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:4, topic:170046”]Yup SRL.scar includes all but some of the scripts in the misc folder.

to make a mistake just do
TypeSend(HumanText(‘TextToSend’, PossibilityOfMistakeInIntForEg16));[/quote]

I never knew of this

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @iron_man_ftw iron man ftw
item.description:
@iron_man_ftw wrote:

I have SRL. Thanks. How would i send the mistaked messages random?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 01:58:17 PM[/size][hr]Anything else that would improve this? Also, which thing would i bring in from SRL to get SendText I tried

program Autotalker; {.include/srl/srl.scar} {.include srl\srl\core\AutoTalk.scar}
and it still wouldn’t work. I tried it with SCAR 3.13 Divi and SCAR 2.03.

EDIT: Never mind, i put in{.Include SRL/SRL.Scar} and it worked.

Read full topic

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

If you have SRL try usign SendText
also, Try using random waits,
EG,
Wait(2000 + Random(3000));

Also try sending the messages randomly

Read full topic

item.title: My very first script (autotalker)
item.dc:creator: @iron_man_ftw iron man ftw
item.description:
@iron_man_ftw wrote:

Here is my autotalker. Please tell me how to improve it. By the way this is my first every working script. Made this in SCAR Divi 3.13. Anything else that I can add that could make this less detectable? I made the wait times a little bit longer then other people i think, but that made it more humanly in my mind (i don’t see how a human can type ‘white:wave:selling dragon bones 1.5kea-yournamehere’ in 2 seconds. Thanks.

[code]//Iron man ftw’s
//First script
//Which is a
//Autotalker
//Tell me what I can do better if you see this

program Autotalker;
{.include/srl/srl.scar}

const
typing1 = ‘White:wave:message here’; //PUT YOUR THING HERE
typing2 = ‘White:wave:mistaked message here’; //Will mistake message every now and then
typing3 = ‘white:wave:another mistake message’; //Another Misspelled message

Procedure Autotalker;
begin
Disguise(‘iTunes’);
wait(2923) //Time to wait before messages
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(3209) //Same thing
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(4223)
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(5232)
sendkeys(typing2); //Mistaked message here
wait(3020)
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(6252)
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(4122)
sendkeys(typing3);
wait(6211)
sendkeys(typing1);
wait(5256)
sendkeys(typing1);
end;

begin
activateclient;
repeat
Autotalker;
until(false)
end.[/code][br][br][size=1]
[size=13pt]
New one here Thanks to Nashi’s help.[/size]

[code]{Iron man ftw’s autotalker]
[Which is his VERY FIRST script]
[Have fun using it]
[Doesn’t have anti randoms, don’t see why it should]
[And doesn’t have auto accept trade, doesn’t seem usefull incase someone spam trades
Or their someone that’s just a noob
If you want that, add it yourself.]
[There IS mistakes added to this to make it more human like}

program Autotalker;
{.Include SRL/SRL.Scar}
{.include srl\srl\core\AutoTalk.scar}

const
typing1 = ‘White:wave:message here’; //PUT YOUR THING HERE
typing2 = ‘White:wave:mistaked message here’; //Will mistake message every now and then
typing3 = ‘white:wave:another mistake message’; //Another Misspelled message

Procedure Autotalker;
begin
SetupSRL;
Disguise(‘iTunes’);
wait(4422 + Random(2133)); //Time to wait before messages
SendText(typing1);
wait(3324 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
wait(3642 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
wait(3754 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing2); //Mistaked message here
wait(3983 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
wait(3576 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
wait(3642 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing3); //Another mistaked message here
wait(3463 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
wait(3823 + Random(2133));
SendText(typing1);
end;

begin
activateclient;
repeat
Autotalker;
until(false)
end.[/code]

[size=15pt]NEWER NEW ONE THANKS TO NASHI’S HELP[/size]

[code]{Iron man ftw’s autotalker]
[Which is his VERY FIRST script]
[Have fun using it]
[Doesn’t have anti randoms, don’t see why it should]
[And doesn’t have auto accept trade, doesn’t seem usefull incase someone spam trades
Or their someone that’s just a noob
If you want that, add it yourself.]
[There IS mistakes added to this to make it more human like}

program Autotalker;
{.Include SRL/SRL.Scar}

const
typing1 = ‘White:wave:message here’; //PUT YOUR THING HERE

Procedure Autotalker;
begin
SetupSRL;
Disguise(‘iTunes’);
wait(2000) //Time to wait before messages
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 25));
wait(1500 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 26));
wait(1762 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 24));
wait(1423 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 27));
wait(2111 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 25));
wait(1982 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 26));
wait(1999 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 24));
wait(1652 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 500));
wait(1782 + Random(2133));
TypeSend(HumanText(typing1, 28));
end;

begin
activateclient;
repeat
Autotalker;
until(isfkeydown(10));
TerminateScript;
end.[/code]

Is there much more i can add to make it less detectable?

Read full topic
